meanings.sent1: Before the journey, the travelers asked the priest to prebless them for a safe trip.
meanings.sent2: It is common for parents to prebless their children before they go to bed.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to prebless the ingredients before starting to cook, just in case.
meanings.sent4: The coach preblessed the team with a motivational speech before the big game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher always preblesses her students with words of encouragement before exams.

meanings.definition: A blessing given before an event or occasion
meanings.sent1: The prebless from the priest brought comfort to the bride before her wedding.
meanings.sent2: The prebless from the elder was a tradition in their family before every meal.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prebless from the stranger made the child smile.
meanings.sent4: The prebless of good luck seemed to linger in the air long after the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The prebless of happiness filled the room with warmth and joy.
